It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. Its leaves are usually opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Marcgravia rectiflora var. jacquinii is often cultivated as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and ability to thrive in humid, warm environments.
